De Leon-Berne Hamiltonian¶

This Hamiltonian has been studied as a model of isomerization of a single molecule that undergoes conformational change and exhibits regular and chaotic dynamics relevant for chemical reactions.

\[\mathcal{H}(x,y,p_x,p_y) = T(p_x, p_y) + V_{\rm DB}(x, y) = \frac{p_x^2}{2m_A} + \frac{p_y^2}{2m_B} + V_{\rm DB}(x, y)\]

where the potential energy function \(V_{\rm DB}(x,y)\) is

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} V_{\rm DB}(x,y) = & V(x) + V(y) + V(x,y) \\ V(y) = & 4y^2(y^2 - 1) + \epsilon_s \\ V(x) = & D_x\left[ 1 - \exp(-\lambda x) \right]^2 \\ V(x,y) = & 4y^2(y^2 - 1)\left[ \exp(-\zeta \lambda x) - 1 \right] \end{align}\end{split}\]

The parameters in the model are \(m_A, m_B\) which represent mass of the isomers, while \(\epsilon_s, D_x\) denote the energy of the saddle, dissociation energy of the Morse oscillator, respectively, and will be kept fixed in this study, \(\lambda, \zeta\) denote the range of the Morse oscillator and coupling parameter between the \(x\) and \(y\) configuration space coordinates, respectively.

Unstable periodic orbits at two values of the total energy for the De Leon-Berne Hamiltonian computed using differential correction method.

deleonberne_hamiltonian.configdiff_deleonberne(guess1, guess2, ham2dof_model, half_period_model, n_turn, par)[source]¶

Returns the difference of x(or y) coordinates between the guess initial conditions and the ith turning points

either difference in x coordintes(x_diff1, x_diff2) or difference in y coordinates(y_diff1, y_diff2) is returned as the result.

deleonberne_hamiltonian.conv_coord_deleonberne(x1, y1, dxdot1, dydot1)[source]¶

Returns the variable we want to keep fixed during differential correction.

dxdot1—-fix x, dydot1—-fix y.

deleonberne_hamiltonian.diffcorr_acc_corr_deleonberne(coords, phi_t1, x0, par)[source]¶

Returns the new guess initial condition of the unstable periodic orbit after applying small correction to the guess.

Correcting x or y coordinate depends on the problem and needs to chosen by inspecting the geometry of the bottleneck in the potential energy surface.

deleonberne_hamiltonian.diffcorr_setup_deleonberne()[source]¶

Returns settings for differential correction method

Settings include choosing coordinates for event criteria, convergence criteria, and correction (see references for details on how to choose these coordinates).

deleonberne_hamiltonian.eigvector_deleonberne(par)[source]¶

Returns the correction factor to the eigenvectors for the linear guess

deleonberne_hamiltonian.get_coord_deleonberne(x, y, E, par)[source]¶

Returns the initial position of x/y-coordinate on the potential energy surface(PES) for a specific energy E.

deleonberne_hamiltonian.grad_pot_deleonberne(x, par)[source]¶

Returns the gradient of the potential energy function V(x,y)

deleonberne_hamiltonian.guess_coords_deleonberne(guess1, guess2, i, n, e, get_coord_model, par)[source]¶

Returns x and y (configuration space) coordinates as guess for the next iteration of the turning point based on confifuration difference method

deleonberne_hamiltonian.guess_lin_deleonberne(eqPt, Ax, par)[source]¶

Returns an initial guess for the unstable periodic orbit

deleonberne_hamiltonian.half_period_deleonberne(t, x, par)[source]¶

Returns the turning point where we want to stop the integration

pxDot = x[0] pyDot = x[1] xDot = x[2] yDot = x[3]

deleonberne_hamiltonian.ham2dof_deleonberne(t, x, par)[source]¶

Returns the Hamiltonian vector field (Hamilton’s equations of motion)

deleonberne_hamiltonian.init_guess_eqpt_deleonberne(eqNum, par)[source]¶

Returns configuration space coordinates of the equilibrium points according to the index: Saddle (EQNUM=1) Centre (EQNUM=2,3)

deleonberne_hamiltonian.jacobian_deleonberne(eqPt, par)[source]¶

Returns Jacobian of the Hamiltonian vector field

deleonberne_hamiltonian.plot_iter_orbit_deleonberne(x, ax, e, par)[source]¶

Plots the orbit in the 3D space of (x,y,p_y) coordinates with the initial and final points marked

deleonberne_hamiltonian.pot_energy_deleonberne(x, y, par)[source]¶

Returns the potential energy function V(x,y)

deleonberne_hamiltonian.variational_eqns_deleonberne(t, PHI, par)[source]¶

Returns the state transition matrix , PHI(t,t0), where Df(t) is the Jacobian of the Hamiltonian vector field

d PHI(t, t0)/dt = Df(t) * PHI(t, t0)
